entry.title: Kioptrix: Level 4
entry.content:
Image: Kioptrix: Level 1.3 (#4)

Nmap output:

There is a member login on the http://192.168.80.154/index.php site, we try the following credentials (SQLi):

We logged into member site and after a few seconds found the local file inclusion vulnerability. Filtering the etc string could be easily evaded for displaying /etc/passwd:

smbmap output reveals:

Now we try to inject php backdoor. For this purpose, we use our session file. The file has a fixed location /var/lib/php5/sess_ with the appended session cookie name:

As we can see, the myusername session variable could be used to easily inject our code:

We need to login using these credentials:

Now we have a backdoor, that uses parameter cmd. Digging deeper, we use python to execute reverse shell:

Because the mysql instance is running as root user, we have a full access to the database. We dump it and use the credentials for ssh login, for example with the user john. The lshell is executed, but noticing his .lhistory file, bash could be directly executed too. Finally, we set the suid privileges for dash using mysql and obtain the root privileges:

Because the UDF exploitation is well known for sqlmap, we could solve the challenge also using this tool:

entry.title: Kioptrix: Level 3
entry.content:
Image: Kioptrix: Level 1.2 (#3)

DHCP client is running on the image and we got assigned this IP address:

We add to ‘/etc/hosts’:

Nmap output:

Nikto output:

After browsing the web page, we can find several vulnerabilities.

SQL injection:

Remote Code execution:

The second one has a Metasploit module that we can use (for LotusCMS):

We invoke a few commands to obtain the shell and upload weevely.

Now we can log to phpmyadmin (found for example by Nikto) with root / fuckeyou credentials:

We found the several interesting things:

In dev_accounts we have:

Using John The Ripper password cracker:

We log as loneferret user and after listing sudo -l we will see that the HT Editor could be invoked.

In editor running with the root privileges we change the /etc/passwd entry according:

We log in as dreg / Mast3r with root privileges and read the congratulation file, there is some information about alternative solutions / exploits:

entry.title: Kioptrix: Level 2
entry.content:
Image: Kioptrix: Level 1.1 (#2)

Nmap output:

We connect to the web page and log in using username / password (SQLi):

Now we got the access to the “Basic Administrative Web Console”. Trying command injection, we found out that we can inject arbitrary command and execute under web user privileges.

Request / response example:

Web server fingerprints:

We don’t have writable access under DocumentRoot. Looking to different directories, we found the netcat source remains.

So there should be netcat installed, we will need this information later.

We can read index.php for mysql credentials:

The john’s password doesn’t work for ssh, but at least we can extract more from mysql database:

Again, the passwords don’t work for ssh.

We find netcat and use it to bind a shell, then we try to root the box:

Luckily, exploitdb contains local root exploit with exactly this version of kernel:

As our last step, we download and compile this exploit https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/9542/ .

entry.title: Kioptrix: Level 1
entry.content:
Image: Kioptrix: Level 1 (#1)

Nmap output:

Enumeration of Samba:

The service is running with the root privileges and we can use exploit in Metasploit to obtain root account:

Because Apache is vulnerable, there is another solution. Nikto reports something interesting:

Web server signature:

In exploitdb we find:

Because the exploit is pretty old, we need to update it with these steps:

Finally we run the exploit and cat /etc/shadow with the root privileges.
